original: Lohmander, Knut Bertil, läroverksadjunkt, Mariestad, f. 5/6/05 i Sölvesborg av fil. dr Carl Ludvig L. o. Lydia Andersson. G. 38 m. Gunnie Malmborg. — Stud:ex. i Linköp., teol. fil. ex., särsk. prövn. f. teol. kand. i Lund, provår v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 44. Res. t. Finl., Danm., Tyskl., Tjeckoslov., Danzig o. Litauen. Tjg. v. Lunds komm. mellansk. 38-39, i Sundsvall 39 o. i Ö’stersund 40, kortare vik. v. Lunds komm. flicksk. 40, Malmö komm. rnellansk., i Sölvesborg, i Ldn-köp. 41, v. Hjo komm. mellansk. 41-45, i Norrköp. 45, adj. i kristend :kunsk. o. liist. m. samhdära v. Mariestads samrealsk. ’sed. 46. Lär. v. Ignaberga forts :sk. 31 o. 32, i Hjo 43, v. Lärar-aspir. förenings nybörjarkurser i hebr. i Lund 37 o. 38, priv. lär. i hebr. 28-39. Hobby: ornitologi.
translated: Lohmander, Knut Bertil, lower secondary school teacher, Mariestad, born on 5/6/05 in Sölvesborg to Dr. Carl Ludvig Lohmander and Lydia Andersson. Married in 1938 to Gunnie Malmborg. Completed secondary school in Linköping, theology and philosophy degrees, special examination for theology candidate in Lund, probationary year at Hvitfeldtska high school in Gothenburg in 1944. Traveled to Finland, Denmark, Germany, Czechoslovakia, Danzig, and Lithuania. Served in Lund's municipal middle school from 1938-1939, in Sundsvall in 1939, and in Östersund in 1940. Brief substitute position at Lund's municipal girls' school in 1940, lower secondary school teacher for Malmö municipality, in Sölvesborg and Lundköpinge in 1941, municipal middle school in Hjo from 1941-1945, in Norrköping in 1945, adjunct teacher in Christian knowledge and history at Mariestad's secondary school since 1946. Taught at Ignaberga secondary school in 1931 and 1932, in Hjo in 1943. Taught beginner courses in Hebrew for the Teacher-Trainees' Association in Lund in 1937 and 1938. Private Hebrew teacher from 1928-1939. Hobby: ornithology.
